params.text:
Professional Writing

Exchange Simple Information:

Language in Action

• Asking for and verifying information
  • Answering questions
  • Refer to future contact
Professional Writing: Introduction

This module will equip you with the essential skills to exchange information clearly and professionally in writing via email. 

You'll learn how to:

1. Ask for and verify information to ensure clarity and avoid misunderstandings.

  2. Answer questions concisely and directly, providing the necessary details.

  3. Refer to future contact to set expectations and ensure continued communication.

params.textField:
Dear Ms. Smith,
I am writing to follow up on the recent project meeting about the website update.
Could you please *tell* me the specific deadline for completing the design phase?
Just to *confirm*, we will be receiving the final content for all website pages by the end of next month, is that *right*?
I would be *grateful* if you could also send me a copy of the latest project timeline for my reference.
Thank you for your time and *assistance*.
Sincerely,
David Miller

params.text: Email 1:

Subject: Order Confirmation and Next Steps - Marketing Materials

Dear Mr. Jones,

Thank you for confirming my order for marketing materials. I received the confirmation email and I am happy to move forward.

I would like to know the estimated delivery time for the order. Could you please let me know when I can expect to receive the delivery?

Also, is there anything else I need to do to prepare for the arrival of the materials?

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Lisa Rodriguez
Email 2:

Subject: Confirmation - Meeting about Training Schedule

Dear Ms. Garcia,

This email is to confirm our meeting tomorrow at 2 pm to discuss the upcoming training program for new employees.

Just to confirm, the meeting will take place in the conference room on the second floor, is that right?

Is there anything specific you would like me to bring to the meeting, or any topics you would like to cover in particular?

Thank you, and I look forward to seeing you tomorrow.

Sincerely,

Omar Khan

When is the deadline for this report? *The deadline is next Monday.*
Could you send me the meeting agenda for tomorrow's meeting? *Sure, no problem. I can attach it to this email.*
I don't quite understand the instructions for this assignment. Can you clarify? *Of course, here are some additional details that might be helpful.*
Is there anything else I need to bring to the meeting? *Please let me know if you have any other questions.*
I would like to know the estimated delivery time for my order. *I will let you know as soon as I have an update on the shipment.*

params.text: Email:

Dear David Miller,

Thank you for your email.

Here is the information you requested:

•    The deadline for completing the design phase is July 15th.
•    Yes, you will be receiving the final content for all website pages by the end of next month.

I have also attached the latest project timeline to this email for your reference.

Please let me know if you have any other questions.

Sincerely,

Ms. Smith
Refer To Future Contact: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Let me know if you have any questions.
dialogs.answer: Use this when you've provided information but want to ensure the recipient understands everything.

dialogs.text: I will get in touch with you as soon as I have more information.
dialogs.answer: This is useful when you can't provide a complete answer yet, but want to assure the recipient you'll follow up.

dialogs.text: I look forward to hearing from you soon.
dialogs.answer: Use this when you're waiting for a response or hoping to continue the conversation..

dialogs.text: Please don't hesitate to contact me if you need anything.
dialogs.answer: This shows the recipient you're willing to help beyond the current email exchange.

dialogs.text: We will discuss this further at our next meeting.
dialogs.answer: Use this when a topic requires more detailed conversation and a meeting is already scheduled.

dialogs.text: I will follow up with you on this.
dialogs.answer: This is a simple way to express that you'll be contacting them again in the future about the same topic.

params.text:
When writing professional emails, it's important to consider how you want to keep the conversation going or provide information about future contact.

Here are some phrases you can use to achieve this:
Refer To Future Contact - Read & Quiz
Please read the following email and answer the questions below:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does the email say about the shipment of the marketing materials?
answers:
The shipment will be sent within 5 business days. 

The shipment will arrive within 5 days.

The order has already been shipped.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does David Jones offer at the end of the email?
answers:
Further assistance if Ms. Lee needs it

A discount on future orders. 

To schedule a follow-up meeting.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What phrase in the email shows the sender is referring to future contact?
answers:
"We look forward to hearing from you..." 

"We expect your order to be shipped..." 

"Thank you for your order."

params.text: Email:

Dear Ms. Lee,

Thank you for your order for marketing materials.

Your order includes:

  • 500 brochures (English)
  • 200 flyers (Spanish)
  • 100 roll-up banners

We expect your order to be shipped within 5 business days. You will receive a tracking number once your shipment is on its way.

Please let us know if you have any questions about your order.

We look forward to hearing from you if you need anything else in the future!

Sincerely,

David Jones Marketing Assistant

Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question to demonstrate your understanding of the key skills for concluding professional writing effectively.

choices.question: Question 1 of 4: How can you politely ask for clarification in an email?
answers:
Can you clarify...? 

What do you mean by...? 

I don't understand this.

choices.question: Question 2 of 4: How can you show the recipient you'll provide them with more information later?
answers:
I will get in touch with you as soon as I have more information.

I don't know yet. 

Can’t John do it?

choices.question: Question 3 of 4: What phrase can you use to show you're open to further communication from the recipient?
answers:
Let me know if you have any questions. 

That's all. 

Goodbye.

choices.question: Question 4 of 4: How can you indicate you'll contact the recipient again about the same topic?
answers:
I will follow up with you on this. 

I'm done with this for now. 

Talk to you tomorrow.
